sentences.text: The '''2025 IHF World Women's Handball Championship''' will be 27th edition of the championship to be jointly hosted by Germany and the Netherlands under the aegis of International Handball Federation (IHF) from 26 November to 14 December 2025. It will be fourth time in history that the championship is jointly hosted. "Catch the Dream" will be the official motto of the competition.

references.text: <ref>{{cite web|title=IHF Council awards events up to 2027 |url=https://www.ihf.info/media-center/news/ihf-council-awards-events-2027 |date=28 February 2020 |publisher=IHF |access-date=26 August 2020}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 5 April 2023 the Netherlands Handball Association presented the Dutch venues:

references.text: <ref name="Motto and Dutch venues"/><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.handbal.nl/blog/2023/04/05/de-organisatie-wk-handbal-2025-kiest-voor-speelsteden-rotterdam-en-s-hertogenbosch/ |title=De organisatie WK Handbal 2025 kiest voor speelsteden Rotterdam en 's-Hertogenbosch |publisher=HandbalNL |language=nl|date=5 April 2023|access-date=8 April 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text: Egypt women's national handball team|Egypt, Faroe Islands women's national handball team|Faroe Islands and Switzerland women's national handball team|Switzerland will make their debut at the championship, with the Faroe Islands becoming the smallest nation to ever qualify, overtaking Greenland women's national handball team|Greenland. Of the returnees, after receiving a wildcard, Uruguay women's national handball team|Uruguay return for the first time since 2011 World Women's Handball Championship|2011. Cuba women's national handball team|Cuba came back after their last appearance was in 2019 World Women's Handball Championship|2019. Tunisia women's national handball team|Tunisia, return after missing out on 2023 World Women's Handball Championship|2023. Iceland women's national handball team|Iceland and Senegal women's national handball team|Senegal qualified for two consecutive finals for the first time. Originally, China women's national handball team|China failed to qualify after finishing outside the top four at the Asian Championship, however, they were belatedly given a wildcard, continuing run of making every world championship since 1986 World Women's Handball Championship|1986.

references.text: <ref name="auto">{{Cite web|url=https://www.ihf.info/media-center/news/peoples-republic-china-granted-wild-card-2025-ihf-womens-world-championship|title=IHF | People's Republic of China granted wild card for the 2025 IHF Women's World Championship|website=www.ihf.info}}</ref>

sentences.text: Notable absentees include Slovenia women's national handball team|Slovenia whose last failure to qualify was 2015 World Women's Handball Championship|2015, while Croatia women's national handball team|Croatia, Cameroon women's national handball team|Cameroon, Congo women's national handball team|Congo and Paraguay women's national handball team|Paraguay all failed to qualify having participated at the previous two championships. 2023 particpants, Greenland women's national handball team|Greenland will not qualify after failing to enter the 2025 Nor.Ca. Women's Handball Championship for financial reasons. Chile women's national handball team|Chile failed to qualify after taking part in 2023 World Women's Handball Championship|2023.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.ihf.info/media-center/news/five-teams-battle-coveted-title-2025-nachc-womens-handball-championship|title=IHF | Five teams to battle for coveted title at the 2025 NACHC Women's Handball Championship|website=www.ihf.info}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 31 March 2025, China was given the first wildcard due to good performances and country's position, making it a big market for the sport.

references.text: <ref name="auto"/> United States women's national handball team|United States is likely to receive the other wildcard, so the team can use this opportunity to prepare for the 2028 Summer Olympics which they will be hosting.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.ihf.info/sites/default/files/2019-09/New%20Markets_Strategic%20plan%20USA.pdf|publisher=IHF|title=Strategic plan {{!}} USA}}</ref>

sentences.text: The schedule was announced on 21 November 2024.

references.text: <ref>{{cite web|title=Match schedule released and tickets on sale for 2025 IHF Women's World Championship|url=https://www.ihf.info/media-center/news/match-schedule-released-and-tickets-sale-2025-ihf-womens-world-championship|publisher=IHF|date=21 November 2024}}</ref>
